metadata.title: CVE-2018-5383 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Bluetooth firmware or operating system software drivers in macOS versionsbefore 10.13, High Sierra and iOS versions before 11.4, and Androidversions before the 2018-06-05 patch may not sufficiently validate ellipticcurve parameters used to generate public keys during a Diffie-Hellman keyexchange, which may allow a remote attacker to obtain the encryption keyused by the device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5383` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1004-raspi2 - 5.4.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1005-aws - 5.4.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1033-gke - 5.4.0-1033.35
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-5.8.0-23-generic-lpae - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-generic-64k - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.8.0-23-lowlatency - 5.8.0-23.24~20.04.1
No subscription required
